column4: so nobody's got a preseed.cfg that skips everything but disk/mbr questions?
there is a gui tool to create preseed.cfg but I've never used it
do you have a name for that?
it's kickstart  but the verison in ubuntu 10.04 didn't work
kickstart and preseed are different things - same tool does both?
kickstart is the gui that creates the proseed.cfg file for you
well, from what I can see, it creates ks.cfg, not preseed.cfg, which are two vastly different config files
or maybe I'm confused it with something else,  oh ok but it creates a config to automate install, is that what preseed.cfg does
kickstart is the redhat-derived autoinstall configuration system, but preseed is the debian-installer specific one
afaik, ks.cfg is not very well supported on debian
well I pulled kickstart from ppa that supports ubuntu
do you have a URL to that ppa?
not off hand but this is the first I found http://serverfault.com/questions/295174/upgrade-the-ubuntu-puppet-package-within-kickstart-process
also note I've never used it just looked at it and was thinking of using it

well, the system-config-kickstart gui program works, and it does create a config file, but I need preseed, not kickstart, because kickstart is too coarse to handle the details I want to configure.....
I've been working actively on my pxe network booting setup for some time now (using the awesome ipxe) and now I'm trying to minimize the amount of typing I have to do on each ubuntu install
sounds cool,  I never seen ipxe before,  I have a standard pxe boot install setup for iso files
the main benefit is that it supports loading files via http, which is so much faster than tftp
if you're into it, please join us in #ipxe
